Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a rough light-brown slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394802) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394802)
